official-title.#text:
To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to
		  provide for an expert advisory panel regarding relative value scale process
		  used under the Medicare physician fee schedule, and for other
		  purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on

, for a
			 period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for
			 consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the
			 committee concerned

short-title.#text:
Accuracy in Medicare Physician Payment
			 Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end
			 the following new subparagraph:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 1848(c)(2) of
			 the Social Security Act

header.#text:
Expert advisory
			 panel regarding relative value scale process used in Medicare physician fee
			 schedule

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
) relating to valuation of physicians’ services, not later than
				90 days after the date of the enactment of this subparagraph, the

shall establish and appoint an expert outside advisory panel (in this
				subparagraph referred to as the

text.#text:
For purposes of
				providing oversight to the processes (including the process described in

The panel shall be
				composed of individuals with expertise in the valuation of physicians’
				services, such as individuals who are medical directors for carriers, experts
				in medical economics and technology diffusion, and private payer plan
				representatives, and shall include a mix of physicians in different specialty
				areas, particularly physicians who are not directly affected by changes in the
				valuation of physicians’ services under this section (such as retired
				physicians and physicians who are employed by managed care organizations or
				academic medical centers), as well as representatives of individuals enrolled
				under this part.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may be conducted directly or through
				contracts with appropriate, qualified entities.

text.#text:
The panel shall provide oversight to the processes of
				identifying, reviewing, and adjusting valuations for physicians’ services under
				this section, including activities described in the succeeding provisions of
				this clause.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
) and other means for identifying physicians’ services for which there
				are potentially misvalued codes for review, such as services that have
				experienced substantial changes in length of stay, site of service, volume,
				practice expense, and other factors that may indicate changes in physician
				work.

text.#text:
The panel may
				establish screens (in addition to the screens identified under

The panel may
				collect data and develop supporting evidence relating to the valuation of
				physicians’ services.

The
				panel may conduct surveys of suppliers of physicians’ services and may conduct
				time and motion studies relating to such valuations.

The panel may transmit with supporting
				evidence codes for review and recommendations through the means described in

header.#text:
Transmitting
				codes for review and recommendations

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
or otherwise) and report to
				the

text.#text:
The
				panel shall evaluate any recommendations submitted through such means (whether
				pursuant to the solicitation under

shall provide for the transfer of not to exceed $10,000,000 for each
				fiscal year (beginning with fiscal year 2014) from the Federal Medical

to the
				Center for Medicare & Medicaid Services Program Management Account to carry
